newsitem.title: LIBERIA: SOCCER-CASH CRISIS THREATENS LIBERIA'S NATIONS' CUP HOPES.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CASH CRISIS THREATENS LIBERIA'S NATIONS' CUP HOPES.

text.p: Lack of cash threatens to sideline war-ravaged Liberia and world footballer of the year George Weah from the 1998 African Nations' Cup.
An attempt to organise a flight for the home-based players to Zaire for Sunday's group six qualifier failed late on Friday, the players said.
The players said they were hoping for a successful 11th hour compromise deal between the government and a private airline on Saturday.
Weah, the AC Milan player who paid $40,000 out of his own pocket to fund the last two qualifiers against Gambia, was in Abidjan and not immediately available for comment.
Soccer is one of the few things that unite Liberia where almost seven years of civil war has killed well over 150,000 people.
Players and fans picketed the finance ministry in Monrovia last week, demanding that the government release funds. In the event, the government lacked enough ready cash.
